sentences.english: However, Di Gong morally justified to argue without compromise.

definition: to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to speak forcibly out of a sense of righteousness (idiom)
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
impassioned/vehement
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
rather die than submit (idiom)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
sanctimonious/dignified
utterly fearless
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
upright gentleman/man of honor
to place righteousness before family (idiom); ready to punish one's own family if justice demands it
not to submit to force
to have no sense of shame
greedy for life, afraid of death (idiom); craven and cowardly/clinging abjectly to life/only interested in saving one's neck
